p: The known case-fatality data for COVID-19 in the European countries (mainly Mediterranean), which have four weather seasons per year, show a high case fatality in Italy (8.3%), Spain (4, 6%), France (2.2%) and Greece (1.3%). On the other hand, the Nordic countries, where the winter season is more extensive (up to 8 months of rain and snow), and the mortality rates are lower: Denmark (0.4%), Iceland (0.3), Norway (0.3%), Sweden (0.7%), and Finland (no deaths).
